page.title: 12HORNCHURCH SWIMMING POOL
page.content: Hornchurch Swimming Pool is just at the edge of Harrow Lodge Park. It was built in 1956. It was the first swimming pool to be built in Britain after the Second World War. This was because all building materials were being used to replace bomb-damaged property. It was built to a new design with the changing rooms away from the poolside and a spectator gallery along one side. This design is still used for most swimming pools today. An additional pool was built alongside the main pool in 1981 for learners and disabled swimmers with toilet and special changing facilities. It is interesting that more people have swimming lessons at Hornchurch Swimming Pool than at any other pool in Britain.
